CVE-2018-15919.summary: Remotely observable behaviour in auth-gss2.c in OpenSSH through 7.8 could be used by remote attackers to detect existence of users on a target system when GSS2 is in use. NOTE: the discoverer states 'We understand that the OpenSSH developers do not want to treat such a username enumeration (or "oracle") as a vulnerability.'

CVE-2018-15473.summary: OpenSSH through 7.7 is prone to a user enumeration vulnerability due to not delaying bailout for an invalid authenticating user until after the packet containing the request has been fully parsed, related to auth2-gss.c, auth2-hostbased.c, and auth2-pubkey.c.

CVE-2017-15906.summary: The process_open function in sftp-server.c in OpenSSH before 7.6 does not properly prevent write operations in readonly mode, which allows attackers to create zero-length files.

							<p>How does an out-of-the-way mountain town—pretty much left for dead a few decades back—make a comeback?  It’s a long story that finally comes down to this: creativity and courage.</p>

																	</a>
															</div>
												
						<div class="slide-entry">

							<h2 class="slide-title">Welcome to Clifton Forge – “A Highlands Treasure.”</h2>
							
							<p>The Town of Clifton Forge, Virginia is a Municipal Corporation and a Political Subdivision of the Commonwealth of Virginia. Although the Town was chartered in 1906, its history dates back to the 1700s. The land that the Town now occupies was originally part of a 1770 land grant to a Robert Gallaspy by Lord Botetourt, the Governor of Virginia.</p>

							<h2 class="slide-title">‘The Business Incubator and Co-Working Center’</h2>
							
							<p>Located in the building next door to town hall, the Incubator offers open and shared space for entrepreneurs, freelancers, start ups, and those looking for an opportunity to network. The center offers: co-working office space, small and large meeting and conference areas, free WIFI access and WIFI accessible copy and fax machines, a small kitchen and lounge, laptops, projector and screen, high def TV with computer port and 24/7 access with security monitoring.</p>

<p><strong>As of OCTOBER 2, 2017 ALL Building Permits will be issued by Alleghany County Building Department located at 9212 Winterberry Ave, Suite A, in Low Moor.</strong>  Permit applications may be picked up at either Alleghany County or Clifton Forge Town Hall.  <strong>Zoning approval will still need to be applied for at Town Hall in Clifton Forge prior to applying for a permit at Alleghany County.  </strong> If you are unsure, please ask and you will be directed as to the proper route to follow.</p>
<p>Any questions can be directed to Darlene Burcham with the Town of Clifton Forge at 540.863.2500 or Beth Stull with Alleghany County at 540.863.6650.</p>
<p><strong><a href="//www.cliftonforgeva.gov/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/NOTICE-TO-PUBLIC-RE-NEW-BUILDING-PERMIT-PROCEDURE.pdf" target="_self" rel="noopener nofollow noreferrer" data-wpel-link="internal">Read the flyer</a></strong></p>

</div></div></div><div class="widget-col-third"><div id="black-studio-tinymce-24" class="widget widget_black_studio_tinymce"><h3 class="widgettitle">Working Together, It Happens More Than You Think</h3><div class="textwidget"><p>For Immediate Release</p>
<p><strong>Working Together, It Happens More Than You Think</strong></p>
<p>By Mayor Tom Sibold, Vice Mayor Gayle Hillert</p>
<p>As elected officials, we hear requests for many things from residents of our communities.  Some are easy to achieve and some more difficult.  In the Alleghany Highlands, to survive and thrive, it is best to work together as one entity using the strengths and contributions of Covington, Iron Gate Alleghany County and Clifton Forge.  In the most recent election, we heard that sentiment expressed many times.</p>
<p><strong><a href="//cliftonforgeva.gov/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/Town-of-Clifton-Forge-Va-Working-Together-It-Happens-More-Than-You-Think.pdf" data-wpel-link="external" rel="external noopener noreferrer">read more...</a></strong></p>
<p> </p>
</div></div></div><div class="widget-col-third"><div id="black-studio-tinymce-33" class="widget widget_black_studio_tinymce"><h3 class="widgettitle">Virginia Tech’s Save Our Towns Videos</h3><div class="textwidget"><p style="text-align: center;"><a href="//www.saveourtowns.outreach.vt.edu/2015/08/season-two-episode-1/" data-wpel-link="external" rel="external noopener noreferrer"><img class="aligncenter wp-image-1036203 size-medium" src="//cliftonforgeva.gov/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/Town-of-Clifton-Forge-VA-Virginia-Tech-Save-Our-Towns-300x271.png" alt="Town of Clifton Forge VA - Virginia Tech "Save Our Towns"" width="300" height="271" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="//www.saveourtowns.outreach.vt.edu/2015/08/season-two-episode-1/" data-wpel-link="external" rel="external noopener noreferrer">Virginia Tech's <strong><em>Save</em><em> Our Towns</em> </strong>monthly Internet<strong> </strong>video series</a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>Watch the <a href="//www.saveourtowns.outreach.vt.edu/2015/08/season-two-episode-1/" data-wpel-link="external" rel="external noopener noreferrer">Season 2 Premiere about Clifton Forge</a>!  Aysha Alsane, student in the College of Architecture and Urban Studies talks about the projects here!</strong></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="//www.saveourtowns.outreach.vt.edu/2015/08/season-two-episode-1/" data-wpel-link="external" rel="external noopener noreferrer">Presented by Virginia Tech, <strong><em>Save Our Towns</em></strong> </a>offers a direct line to leaders throughout Appalachia – as well as the state – who share your vision for building a town for the future.</p>
</div></div></div><div class="widget-col-third"><div id="black-studio-tinymce-10" class="widget widget_black_studio_tinymce"><h3 class="widgettitle">Over 100 MILES of Trails</h3><div class="textwidget"><p style="color: #7ac142; text-align: center;"><a href="//www.alleghanyhighlandstrails.com/" data-wpel-link="external" rel="external noopener noreferrer"><img class="size-full wp-image-1033556" src="//cliftonforgeva.gov/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/Clifton-Forge-Va-Alleghany-Highlands-Trails.png" alt="Clifton Forge Va Alleghany Highlands Trails" width="162" height="142" /></a></p>
<p style="color: #7ac142; text-align: center;"><a href="//www.alleghanyhighlandstrails.com/" data-wpel-link="external" rel="external noopener noreferrer">The Alleghany Highlands of Virginia is an outdoor lover’s dream come true.</a></p>
<p style="color: #7ac142;"> </p>
</div></div></div><div class="widget-col-third"><div id="black-studio-tinymce-65" class="widget widget_black_studio_tinymce"><h3 class="widgettitle">Board of Zoning Appeals Vacancies </h3><div class="textwidget"><p style="text-align: center;"><strong>NOTICE</strong></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>Town of Clifton Forge</strong></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>Board of Zoning Appeals Vacancies </strong></p>
<p style="text-align: center;">The Town Council of Clifton Forge is soliciting individuals to apply to fill vacant seats on the Board of Zoning Appeals.</p>
<p style="text-align: center;">The Board of Zoning Appeals meets to hear appeals by persons aggrieved by any decision of the Zoning Administrator.  The Board may reverse, affirm or modify the decision of the Zoning Administrator.  The Board shall, in specific cases, authorize variances from the Zoning Ordinance.  The Board shall grant special exceptions, when authorized by the Zoning Ordinance, upon proper application.</p>
<p style="text-align: center;">Applications for committees and boards are available on the Clifton Forge website at www.cliftonforgeva.gov and the Town Manager’s office at Town Hall.  Please send a letter of interest with your name, address, phone, email address and qualifications to:</p>
<p style="text-align: left;">              Clerk of Clifton Forge Council</p>
<p style="text-align: left;">              P.O. Box 631</p>
<p style="text-align: left;">              Clifton Forge, VA 24422</p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>Applications will be accepted until Monday, April 1, 2019.  Please contact the Town Manager’s office at 540-863-2500 if you have any questions.</strong></p>
</div></div></div>		</div>

			<div class="widget-col-third"><div id="text-14" class="widget widget_text"><h3 class="widgettitle">Town Council – Public Comments Procedure</h3>			<div class="textwidget"><p>NOTICE:  In order to ensure that all persons wishing to address Council have the opportunity to do so and in a timely manner, Council respectfully requests that all attendees keep conversation with each other during the meeting to a minimum.<br />

</div>
		</div></div><div class="widget-col-third"><div id="text-5" class="widget widget_text"><h3 class="widgettitle">The Town Reminds You of These Important Dates</h3>			<div class="textwidget"><p><strong>January 31st</strong> - Animal Tags are due<br />

<p>The scenic drive is a must-see experience for all visiting<a href="//www.virginia.org/Listings/OutdoorsAndSports/HighlandsScenicByway/" target="_blank" data-wpel-link="external" rel="external noopener noreferrer"> <strong>Virginia's Western Highlands</strong></a> and makes the outdoors and nature accessible even to those who would rather not hike into a wilderness area.</p>
